intro: Erophila verna var. serrata, commonly known as the serrated whitehead, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and typically grows in moist, calcareous soils. The plant features small, white to pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped with serrated edges, giving it its common name. It is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local insect populations.
